title: The Yard (2011 TV series)
text:
The Yard is a Canadian <a href="mockumentary">mockumentary</a> comedy series that originally aired on <a href="HBO%20Canada">HBO Canada</a> in 2011. Set in a schoolyard, the series depicts the interactions of two rival gangs of <a href="elementary%20school">elementary school</a> students, with the plot of each episode serving as a <a href="parody">parody</a> of an adult-oriented crime drama series such as "<a href="The%20Sopranos">The Sopranos</a>" or "<a href="The%20Wire">The Wire</a>". In the United States, it is available for online streaming exclusively on <a href="Hulu">Hulu</a> in both "censored" and "uncensored" versions and for <a href="1080p">1080p</a> <a href="High-definition%20video">HD</a> digital download on the <a href="iTunes%20Store">iTunes Store</a>.
Plot.
The series is seen by an unseen documentarian, voiced by <a href="Paul%20Gross">Paul Gross</a>, at Parker Elementary School in Canada. Providing both behind-the-scenes footage and interviews with the kids intercut with the main drama.
Reception.
Bill Harris of the "<a href="Toronto%20Sun">Toronto Sun</a>" called The Yard "kiddie ‘Sopranos’". "<a href="The%20Grid%20%28newspaper%29">The Grid</a>" called it ""<a href="The%20Wire">The Wire</a> Babies"".
